newsitem.title: HONG KONG: UK'S Clarke sees Euro-zone/currency by century end.
newsitem.headline: UK'S Clarke sees Euro-zone/currency by century end.

text.p: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke said in Hong Kong on Friday he saw a Euro-zone and the development of a Euro currency by the turn of the century if not on January 1, 1999.

"Preparation for the emergence of economic and monetary union at every level has been perhaps delayed too long in too many places," Clarke told an IMF-Hong Kong Monetary Authority Conference on financial integration in Asia and the role of Hong Kong.
At the "micro-level in Europe" only now were "the immediate practical costs and implications of change being addressed in many sectors of our economy," Clarke said.
"We are going to see a Euro-zone emerge and the development of the Euro as a currency by the turn of the century if not on January 1, 1999.
"There's a very powerful political impetus behind the whole development."
